title: Avi Mizrahi
text:
<a href="Aluf">Aluf</a> Avi (Abraham) Mizrahi (; born 1957) is a general in the <a href="Israel%20Defense%20Forces">Israel Defense Forces</a>, the Head of <a href="Central%20Command%20%28Israel%29">Israeli Central Command</a> between October 2009 and March 2012.
Military career.
Mizrahi was drafted by the IDF in 1975, and joined Sayeret Golani (95th Recon. Company), the SF unit of the <a href="Golani%20Brigade">1st Infantry Brigade</a>. He later entered the <a href="Israeli%20Armor%20Corps">Israeli Armor Corps</a>, where he worked his way up to brigade commander. After that he served as the representative of the IDF <a href="GOC%20Army%20Headquarters">GOC Army Headquarters</a> at <a href="United%20States%20Army%20Training%20and%20Doctrine%20Command">United States Army Training and Doctrine Command</a> (TRADOC) and the commander of several formations.
In 2005 Mizrahi was appointed the head of the <a href="Logistics%2C%20Medical%2C%20and%20the%20Centers%20Directorate">Logistics, Medical, and the Centers Directorate</a>, and from 2007 until 2009 he served as the Chief of the Ground forces. Before his most recent appointment, Mizrahi served as the Head of the IDF <a href="GOC%20Army%20Headquarters">GOC Army Headquarters</a>.
Since October 2009 until March 2012 Mizrahi served as the Head of the <a href="Central%20Command%20%28Israel%29">IDF Central Command</a>.
Turkish-Israeli diplomatic incident.
In February 2009, during a speech at the Gelilot military base, Mizrahi caused a diplomatic incident, commenting on sharp critical remarks voiced by Turkish Prime Minister <a href="Recep%20Tayyip%20Erdogan">Recep Tayyip Erdogan</a> over the <a href="Gaza%20War%20%282008%E2%80%9309%29">Gaza War</a>. Mizrahi noted that Turkey had no right to criticize Israel's action as Turkey itself stationed troops in <a href="Northern%20Cyprus">Northern Cyprus</a>, oppressed its <a href="Kurds%20in%20Turkey">Kurdish minority</a>, and <a href="Armenian%20genocide">massacred Armenians</a> during World War I. Israeli ambassador was summoned to Turkey's foreign ministry to explain these remarks, while <a href="IDF%20Spokesperson%27s%20Unit">IDF Spokesperson's Unit</a> issued a statement saying Mizrahi's words do not represent any official position.
